contentrichtext.text: [[File:Mixed Pickles (9370-72).jpg|thumb|Mixed pickles]] '''Mixed pickles''' are [[pickling|pickle]]s made from a variety of vegetables mixed in the same pickling process. Mixed pickles are eaten much like other pickles: in small amounts to add flavor and to accent a meal. Mixed pickles occur in many different world cuisines. In '''[[Cuisine of the United States|U.S. cuisine]]''', a mixed pickle consists of vegetables typically including [[cucumbers]], [[cauliflower]], cut large [[onion]]s, and [[bell pepper]]s, as well as [[spices]] like [[garlic]], [[dill]], [[allspice]], and [[chili pepper|chili]] peppers, suspended in [[vinegar]]. Mixed pickles may also be categorized as [[sweet]] or [[sour]] depending on the addition of a sweetening agent like [[sugar]].<ref>[http://www.ams.usda.gov/AMSv1.0/getfile?dDocName=STELDEV3010786 http://www.ams.usda.gov/AMSv1.0/getfile?dDocName=STELDEV3010786] ''ams.usda.gov''</ref> In '''[[British cuisine]]''', mixed pickles typically include small whole onions, [[gherkin]]s, and cauliflower. Some specific kinds of British mixed pickle are [[Branston pickle]] (more properly termed a [[relish]]), and [[piccalilli]] (the latter also found in U.S. cuisine).<ref>[http://www.bbc.co.uk/dna/h2g2/A3100168 http://www.bbc.co.uk/dna/h2g2/A3100168] ''bbc.co.uk''</ref> In '''[[Indian cuisine]]''', a mixed [[Indian pickle]] is more likely to contain fruits (for example, [[mango]]s and [[Lime (fruit)|limes]]) as well as vegetables. Indian pickle is prepared using oil, unlike western pickles, and is more likely to use lemon juice or some other acid as a souring agent instead of vinegar. There are regional variations in spicing and in the ingredients.<ref>[http://indianfoodsco.com/Submit/Pickles.htm http://indianfoodsco.com/Submit/Pickles.htm] ''indianfoodsco.com''</ref> Recipes for mixed pickles can also be found in [[Chinese cuisine]], [[Middle Eastern cuisine]], and many other world cuisines. ==See also== *[[Chow-chow]] *[[Chutney]] *[[Giardiniera]] *[[Indian pickle]] *[[Pickling]] *[[Tursu]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://maryamgroup.com/product/pickle/pickle%202.htm Pickles around the world] *[http://www.britsuperstore.com/acatalog/Haywards.html Photos of Western mixed pickles] (second to last and third to last photos) [[Category:Pickles]] [[Category:Indian pickles]] {{condiment-stub}}
